activities.loc: Courtroom E, Fourth Floor - South Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley David Thrasher

records.addlTxt: 10:03 AM Defendant Bradley David Thrasher not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Anne Theresa Nack and intern Verity Altenberger  appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Cuco Longoria for Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video with authorization for Bradley David Thrasher. Amended complaint filed. State amends charges to an ordinance charge of 1 Count Battery. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court finds Defendant guilty and orders $100 forfeiture plus costs due within 60 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Calendar call on November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:16 PM Defendant Bradley David Thrasher in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Colin T Nicholson by video.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $650 Signature Bond with conditions:  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact directly or indirectly with victim K.T., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except for one time trip with law enforcement to retrieve personal belongings. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 3:00 PM.
